official-title.#text:
To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide research, training, and navigator services to
			 youth and young adults on the verge of aging out of the secondary
			 educational system, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Assistance in Gaining Experience, Independence, and Navigation Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Assistance in Gaining Experience, Independence, and Navigation Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part R of title III of the Public Health Service Act

header.#text: Amendment to the Public Health Service Act
Grants for research, training, and navigator services for youth and young adults

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the Coordinating Committee established under

, shall award
			 a grant to a research organization to—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Administration for Community Living

text.#text: The

conduct a comprehensive meta-analysis on the existing empirical, peer-reviewed research on the
			 topic of youth and young adults with an autism spectrum disorder or other
			 developmental disabilities as such individuals age-out of the school-based
			 support system (referred to in this section as

conduct research on the existing infrastructure for transitioning youth, including access to health
			 care, continuing education and vocational training programs, supportive
			 and community-based integrated housing, accessible transportation
			 services, and public safety and community integration programs (including
			 first responder training); and

develop a comprehensive strategic plan (in accordance with paragraph (2)) for the establishment of
			 a Transition Navigator grant program to provide transitioning youth with a
			 comprehensive and interdisciplinary set of support services.
The strategic plan developed under paragraph (1)(C) shall include—

proposals on establishing best practices guidelines to ensure interdisciplinary coordination
			 between all relevant service providers (including first responders), the
			 transitioning youth, and their family, and in conjunction with the
			 transitioning youth's Individualized Education Plan as prescribed in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , to maximize the transitioning youth’s self-determination;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 614 of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act

text.#text: comprehensive approaches to transitioning, including—

services to increase access to, and the successful integration and completion of, postsecondary
			 education, peer support, vocational training (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
), self-advocacy skills, and
			 competitive, integrated employment;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 103 of
			 the Rehabilitation Act of 1973

text.#text: community-based behavioral supports and interventions;
community-based integrated residential services, housing, and transportation;
nutrition, health and wellness, recreational, and social activities; and
culturally and linguistically competent and sensitive service delivery models; and
proposals which seek to—
increase the effectiveness of such practices to provide successful transition services;

increase the ability of the entity to provide supports and services to underserved populations and
			 regions;
increase the efficiency of service delivery to maximize resources and outcomes; and
ensure access to all services identified as necessary to transitioning youth of all capabilities.
Grants awarded under this subsection shall be for a period of 2 years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the Coordinating Committee established under

, shall
			 establish a Transition Navigator Grant Program to award multiyear training
			 initiative grants to establish and carry out a collaborative,
			 interdisciplinary training and services initiative, that is based on the
			 data and best practice guidelines developed under subsection (a), to train
			 transition navigators to provide transitioning youth with the services and
			 skills necessary to lead an independent, integrated life.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Administration for Community Living

the ability to provide training services to a culturally diverse set of students and in a
			 culturally competent, culturally sensitive manner; and
the ability to train providers in underserved areas and to serve underserved populations.

whether and to what extent the training regime sufficiently met the goals of the strategic plan

whether and to what extent graduates of the training program are successfully working to provide

			 appropriate manner; and

the long-term efficacy of the program and the strategic plan on increasing and sustaining
			 transitional youth’s—
enrollment in, and completion of, postsecondary education or vocational training programs;
participation in integrated, competitive employment;
continued access to peer support;
continued access to, and benefitting from, community-based behavioral supports and interventions;

consistent access to community-based integrated residential services, housing, and transportation;

continued access to nutrition, health and wellness, recreational, and social activities.

text.#text:
A third-party organization that enters into a contract under subparagraph (A) shall monitor
			 grantees under this subsection and report back to the

Activities carried out under a grant under this subsection shall supplement, not supplant, existing
			 programs and activities designed to provide interdisciplinary training to
			 services providers aimed at serving transitional youth.
